notes.p: You terrify your enemies into retreating, creating chaos in their ranks

id-01099.trigger: The target gains a condition or effect that is ended by a saving throw or that ends at the end of their turn.

id-01100.effect: Each target takes holy damage equal to twice your Presence score. Additionally, each hidden target is automatically revealed and can’t become hidden again until the start of your next turn. You can then use your Judgment ability against one target as a free triggered action.
id-01100.name: Revelator (5 Wrath)

notes.p: You channel holy energy to harm unbelievers and reveal those hidden from your judgment.
You reveal a vision of your enemies’ fate that causes them to scramble as it staggers them.

id-01102.effect: If the target is already frightened of you or another creature and this ability would frighten them again, they instead take psychic damage equal to twice your Presence score.

id-01102.tier3: 15 + M holy damage; P<Strong , frightened (save ends)

notes.p: You anticipate your foes’ moves and deny them.

id-01104.effect: Each ally can shift up to 2 squares and gains 2 surges before making the strike.

Until the end of the encounter or until you are dying, 
whenever a target makes a strike, they take holy damage equal to 
twice your Presence score. A target judged by you takes an extra 2d6 
holy damage.

id-01114.name: Gods Grant Thee Strength (9 Wrath)

id-01117.tier3: 20 + M damage; you and each ally adjacent to you gain 20 temporary Stamina

When either duplicate takes damage, it is destroyed.

.Whenever a target makes a power roll, they can roll three dice and choose which two rolls to use.

.Whenever a target makes a power roll, they must roll three dice and use the lowest two rolls

id-02115.effect:
You conjure a size 4 dragon that appears in an unoccupied space within distance. The dragon has speed 6 and can fly, stability 4, 100 Stamina, immunity all to fire damage, and uses your characteristics. The dragon disappears at the end of the encounter, if their Stamina drops to 0, or if you are dying.

On subsequent turns, you can use a main action to command the dragon to breathe magic fire in a 3 cube within 1 square of them. Make the following power roll targeting each enemy in the area.

Additionally, you can use a maneuver to move the dragon up to their speed, or to make a melee weapon strike with their claw against an adjacent creature or object. The dragon can also make this strike as a free strike. 
(See divine dragon claw attack above)

id-02116.effect: The Dragon can make this attack as a free Strike.

id-02116.special: This is part of the Divine Dragon Ability.

id-02117.effect: Before the target dies, you can look at their stat block and force them to use one ability that is a main action or a maneuver. If the ability costs a Heroic Resource or Malice, the creature can use it without any cost. For the purpose of using this ability, your allies and enemies are the target’s allies and enemies, and you decide who the ability targets.

id-03002.effect:
Choose one of the following effects:
♦ You use the Knockback maneuver, but its distance becomes the range of your Hurl Element ability, and you use Reason instead of Might for the power roll.

♦ You choose a creature within the distance of your Hurl Element ability and one of the following damage types: acid, cold, corruption, fire, lightning, poison, or sonic. That creature takes damage of the chosen type equal to your Reason score.

♦ You teleport up to a number of squares equal to your Reason score. If you choose this option, you can spend essence to teleport 1 additional square for each essence spent.
id-03002.name: Practical Magic

notes.p: Your mastery of elemental power lets you customize your conjurations.

id-03003.effect: For each Victory you have, you can target one creature. Each target gains the benefit of your A Beyonding of Vision feature until\nthe end of your next turn, but doesn’t gain the use of the Shared Void Sense ability.
id-03003.name: Shared Void Sense

notes.p: You grant allies a taste of your unearthly vision.

id-03006.effect: You touch a square containing mundane dirt, stone, or metal and create a 5 wall of the same material, which rises up out of the\nground and must include the square you touched. Alternatively, you touch a structure made of mundane dirt, stone, or metal that occupies 2 or more squares. You can open a 1-square opening in the structure where you touched it. You can instead touch an existing doorway or other opening that is 1 square or smaller in a mundane dirt, stone, or metal surface. The opening is sealed by the same material that makes up the surface.
id-03006.name: Motivate Earth

notes.p: The earth rises, falls, or opens up at your command.

id-03007.effect: You heat the target and cause it to melt or combust, destroying it. If the object is larger than 1 square, then only the square of the object you touch is destroyed.
id-03007.name: Return to Formlessness

notes.p: With the merest touch, you cause an object to turn to slag or ash

id-03009.effect: You teleport the target up to a number of squares equal to your Reason score. If the target moves to trigger this ability, you can teleport them at any point during the move.
id-03009.name: Subtle Relocation

notes.p: You call on the void to swallow and spit out an ally

id-03009.special: Spend 1 Essence: You teleport the target up to a number of squares equal to twice your Reason score instead.
id-03009.trigger: The target starts their turn, moves, or is force moved.

id-03010.effect: The target can spend a Recovery.
id-03010.name: Breath of Dawn Remembered

notes.p: The power you channel grants the ability to get back in the fight.

id-03010.special: Spend 1+ Essence: The target can spend an additional Recovery for each essence spent.
id-03010.trigger: The target starts their turn or takes damage.

id-03011.effect: The forced movement distance gains a bonus equal to your Reason score.
id-03011.name: Explosive Assistance

notes.p: You add a little magic to an ally’s aggression at just the right time.

id-03011.special: Spend 1 Essence: The forced movement distance gains a bonus equal to twice your Reason score instead.
id-03011.trigger: The target force moves a creature or object.

id-03012.effect: The target takes half the damage.
id-03012.name: Skin Like Castle Walls

notes.p: You cover yourself or an ally in protective stone.

id-03012.special: Spend 1 Essence: If the damage has any potency effects associated with it, the potency is reduced by 1 for the target.

notes.p: You inflict pain and doubt in equal measure.
You give your enemy a gentle tap—like an asteroid impact.

id-03015.effect: Choose yourself or one ally within distance. That character can end one effect on them that is ended by a saving throw or that ends at the end of their turn.
id-03015.name: Afflict a Bountiful Decay

notes.p: Your curse causes your foe’s flesh to rot off as spores that aid your allies.
Two jets of flame lance out at your command.

id-03017.effect: You can teleport up to a number of squares equal to your Reason score.
id-03017.name: Grasp of Beyond

notes.p: You absorb the life energy of another creature and use it to teleport.

id-03018.effect: You slide one creature within 10 squares of the target up to 2 squares.
id-03018.name: The Green Within, the Green Without

notes.p: Whipping vines erupt from a foe’s body to grasp at another close by.

id-03019.effect: The ground beneath the area is difficult terrain for enemies.
id-03019.name: Unquiet Ground

notes.p: A sudden storm of detritus assaults your foes and leaves them struggling to move.
A jet of heavy fire erupts where you strike.

id-03021.name: Behold the Mystery (3 Essence)

notes.p: You open a rift into the void to harry your foes.

id-03021.special: Persistent 1: At the start of your turn, you can use a maneuver to use this ability again without spending essence.

id-03022.name: The Flesh, a Crucible (3 Essence)

notes.p: Fire engulfs your target and continues to churn.

id-03022.special: Persistent 1: If the target is within distance at the start of your turn, you can make the power roll again without spending essence.

id-03023.effect: Mushrooms cover the target’s body. While the mushrooms are on the target, you and any ally adjacent to the target gain 1 surge\nwhenever the target takes damage. The mushrooms can be removed by the target or an adjacent creature as a main action.
id-03023.name: Invigorating Growth (3 Essence)

notes.p: Mushrooms erupt from a foe, sapping their vitality to spread strengthening spores

id-03024.effect: You must be touching the ground to use this ability. Additionally, you can choose a square of ground in the area that is\nunoccupied or is occupied by you or any ally. A pillar of earth rises out of the ground in that square, with a height in squares up to your Reason score. The pillar can’t collide with any creatures or objects, nor can it force creatures raised by it to collide with other creatures or objects.
id-03024.name: Ripples in the Earth (3 Essence)

notes.p: Like a stone was dropped into a pond, waves in the earth radiate from you.

id-03025.name: Conflagration (5 Essence)

notes.p: A storm of fire descends upon your enemies.

id-03025.special: Persistent 2: At the start of your turn, you can use a maneuver to use this ability again without spending essence.

id-03026.effect: You open up two holes with 1-square openings that are 4 squares deep, which can be placed on any mundane surface within distance. You can place these holes next to each other to create fewer holes with wider openings. When the holes open, make a separate power roll for each creature on the ground above a hole and\nsmall enough to fall in. (You can’t score a critical hit with this ability because it uses a maneuver.)
id-03026.name: Instantaneous Excavation (5 Essence)

notes.p: The surface of the world around you opens up to swallow foes.

id-03026.special: Persistent 1: At the start of your turn, you open another hole, making a power roll against each creature who could fall into the hole when it opens without spending essence.
id-03026.tier1: The target can shift 1 square from the edge of the hole to the nearest unoccupied space of their choice.
id-03026.tier2: The target falls into the hole.
id-03026.tier3: The target falls into the hole and can’t reduce the height of the fall.

id-03027.effect: Until the start of your next turn, the target can move through solid matter, they ignore difficult terrain, and their movement can’t\nprovoke opportunity attacks. If the target ends their turn inside solid matter, they are forced out into the space where they entered it and this effect ends.
id-03027.name: No More Than a Breeze (5 Essence)

notes.p: The material substance of a creature shreds away at your command.

id-03027.special: Persistent 1: The effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

id-03028.effect: You can end one effect on yourself that is ended by a saving throw or that ends at the end of your turn. Each ally in the area also gains this benefit.
id-03028.name: Test of Rain (5 Essence)

notes.p: You call down a rain that burns your enemies and restores your allies.

id-04071.effect: You take half the damage from the triggering effect and can shift up to a number of squares equal to your Agility score.
id-04071.name: Unearthly Reflexes

p.i: You are as elusive as a hummingbird.

id-04071.special: Spend 1 Ferocity: If the damage has any potency effects associated with it, the potency is reduced by 1 for you.

p.i: A wild assault forces your foe onto their back.

id-04906.effect: You can shift up to the same number of squares that you pushed the target.
id-04906.name: Driving Pounce

p.i: Your enemies try in vain to fall back from your pouncing attack.

id-04907.effect: You can shift up to 2 squares before or after making the power roll.
id-04907.name: Wing Buffet

p.i: Foes who try to close in around you do so at their peril.
Attacks with your sharp and deadly claws grab the weak.

id-04073.effect: You can select a new target of the same size or smaller within distance to be force moved instead. You become the source of the forced movement, determine the new target’s destination, and can push the target instead of using the original forced movement type. Additionally, the forced movement distance gains a bonus equal to your Might score.
id-04073.name: Lines of Force

p.i: You redirect the energy of motion.

id-04073.special: Spend 1 Ferocity: The forced movement distance gains a bonus equal to twice your Might score instead.
id-04073.trigger: The target would be force moved.

id-04074.effect: You gain temporary Stamina equal to your Might score and can enter your animal form or hybrid form.
id-04074.name: Furious Change

p.i: In your anger, you revert to a more bestial form.

id-04074.special: Spend 1 Ferocity: If you are not dying, you can spend a Recovery.
id-04074.trigger: You lose Stamina and are not dying.

id-04078.effect: The targets are force moved one at a time, starting with the target nearest to you, and can be pushed into other targets in the same line.
id-04078.name: Thunder Roar (5 Ferocity)

p.i: You unleash a howl that hurls your enemies back.

id-04099.name: To the Uttermost End (5 Ferocity)

p.i: You gut your life force to ensure a foe’s demise.

id-04099.special: Spend 1+ Ferocity: While you are winded, this ability deals an extra 1d6 damage for each ferocity spent. While you are dying, it deals an extra 1d10 damage for each ferocity spent. In either case, you lose 1d6 Stamina after making this strike.

p.i: You hew about you with your mighty weapon, hurling enemies backward.

id-04001.effect: While bleeding this way, the target takes damage equal to your Might score at the end of each of your turns.
id-04001.name: Your Entrails Are Your Extrails! (3 Ferocity)

p.i: Hard for them to fight when they’re busy holding in their giblets.

id-04002.effect: You move up to your speed in a straight line, and enemy squares are not difficult terrain for this movement. You can end\nthis movement in a creature’s space and move them to an adjacent unoccupied space. You make one power roll that targets each enemy whose space you move through.
id-04002.name: Tide of Death (3 Ferocity)

p.i: Teach them the folly of lining up for you.

id-04002.special: The last target you damage takes extra damage equal to your Might score for each opportunity attack you trigger during your move.

p.i: The heavy impact of your weapon attacks drives your foes ever back.

id-04004.effect: You gain 1 surge, and the next ability roll you make this turn automatically obtains a tier 3 outcome.
id-04004.name: Make Peace With Your God! (5 Ferocity)

p.i: Anger is your energy.

id-04005.effect: You gain 2 surges, and the target can make an opportunity attack against you as a free triggered action.
id-04005.name: To the Death!

p.i: Your reckless assault leaves you tactically vulnerable.

id-04006.effect: When you slide the target, you can move into any square they leave. If you take damage from an opportunity attack by moving this way, the target takes the same damage.
id-04006.name: Out of the Way! (3 Ferocity)

p.i: Your enemies will clear your path—whether they want to or not.

id-04007.name: Impaled!

p.i: You skewer your enemy like a boar upon a spit.

id-04007.target: One creature of your size or smaller

id-04008.effect: You can deal 1d6 damage to yourself to deal an extra 1d6 damage to the target.
id-04008.name: Blood for Blood! (5 Ferocity)

p.i: See how well they fight after you’ve bled them dry.
Staying in constant motion helps you slip out of reach after a brutal assault.

id-05001.effect: Each target reduces their potencies by 1.
id-05001.name: Null Field

notes.p: You project an aura that dampens the power of your foes.

id-05001.special:
Once as a free maneuver on each of your turns, you can spend 1
discipline and give your Null Field one of the following additional
effects until the start of your next turn:
♦ Gravitic Disruption: The first time on a turn that a target takes damage, you can slide them up to 2 squares.
♦ Inertial Anchor: Any target who starts their turn in the area can’t shift.
♦Synaptic Break: Whenever you or any ally uses an ability against a target that has a potency effect, the potency is increased by 1.

This ability remains active even after an encounter ends. It ends only if you are dying or if you willingly end it (no action required).

id-05003.name: Inertial Shield

notes.p: You intuit the course of an incoming attack, reducing its effects.

id-05003.special: Spend 1 Discipline: The potency of one effect associated with the damage is reduced by 1 for you.

id-05004.effect: You can slide one agjacent enemy up to a number of squares equal to your Intuition score.
id-05004.name: Dance of Blows

notes.p: You strike everywhere at once, tricking an enemy into moving out of position.
You strike a key nerve cluster to leave your foe staggered.

id-05006.effect: Before the push is resolved, you teleport the target to a square adjacent to you and opposite the one they started in. If the target can’t be teleported this way, you can’t push them.
id-05006.name: Phase Inversion Strike

notes.p: You step momentarily out of phase as you pull an enemy through you.
The force of your blow extends past the limits of your body, pulling your enemy closer.
You contort your enemy's body into a stance they struggle to escape from.

id-05009.effect: You can shift up to half your speed before or after you make this strike.
id-05009.name: Inertial Step

notes.p: You flit about the battlefield and take an opportunistic strike.

id-05010.effect: You can deal damage equal to your Agility score to one creature or object adjacent to you.
id-05010.name: Faster Than the Eye

notes.p: You strike so quickly that your hands become a blur.
You focus your psionic technique into a concussive punch.

id-05012.effect: Until the start of your next turn, whenever the target moves or is force moved, you can use a free triggered action to shift up to your speed. You must end this shift adjacent to the target.
id-05012.name: Relentless Nemesis (3 Discipline)

notes.p: You strike, and for the next few moments, your enemy can't escape you.

id-05013.effect: Each target takes psychic damage equal to twice your Intuition score. Until the start of your next turn, the size of your Null Field ability increases by 1. At the end of your current turn, each enemy in the area of your Null Field ability takes psychic damage equal to your Intuition score.
id-05013.name: Psychic Pulse (3 Discipline)

notes.p: A burst of psionic energy interferes with your enemy's synapses.

id-05014.effect: You can shift up to half your speed before or after you make this strike. Additionally, whenever an effect lets you make a free strike or use a signature ability, you can use this ability instead, paying its discipline cost as usual.
id-05014.name: Chronal Spike (3 Discipline)

notes.p: You foresee the best moment to strike, then exploit it.

id-05015.effect: You can take the Disengage move action as a free maneuver before or after you use this ability.
id-05015.name: A Squad Unto Myself (5 Discipline)

notes.p: You move so quickly, it seems as though an army assaulted your foes.

id-05016.effect: A target who goes out of phase is slowed, has their stability reduced by 2, and can’t obtain a tier 3 outcome on ability rolls.
id-05016.name: Phase Strike (5 Discipline)

notes.p: For a moment, your foe slips out of phase with this manifold.

id-05016.tier1: 3 + [A] psychic damage; [I]<[WEAK], the target goes out of phase (save ends)
id-05016.tier2: 4 + [A] psychic damage; [I]<[AVERAGE], the target goes out of phase (save ends)
id-05016.tier3: 6 + [A] psychic damage; [I]<[STRONG], the target goes out of phase (save ends)

id-05017.effect: An object you target must be your size or smaller. You gain an edge on this ability. Additionally, for each square you push the target, they take 1 psychic damage.
id-05017.name: Impart Force ( 5 Discipline)

notes.p: A single touch from you, and your enemy flies backwards.

id-05018.effect: While weakened this way, the target takes damage equal to your Intuition score whenever they use a supernatural ability that costs Malice.
id-05018.name: Arcane Disruptor (5 Discipline)

notes.p: Your blow reorders a foe's body, causing pain if they attempt to channel sorcery.

id-06001.effect: You teleport up to 5 squares. If you have concealment or cover at your destination, you can use the Hide maneuver even if you are observed. If you successfully hide using this maneuver, you gain 1 surge
id-06001.name: Black Ash Teleport

notes.p: In a swirl of black ash, you step from one place to another.

id-06001.special: Spend 1+ Insight: You teleport 1 additional square for each insight spent.

id-06002.effect: You gain 2 surges. Additionally, whenever you use a surge before the end of the encounter, you can choose to have it deal poison damage
id-06002.name: Coat the Blade

notes.p: A little poison goes a long way.

id-06002.special: Spend 1+ Insight: For each insight you spend, you gain 1 additional surge

id-06003.effect: You envelop yourself in an illusion that makes you appear nonthreatening and harmless to your enemies. You might take on the appearance of a harmless animal of your size, such as a sheep or capybara, or you might appear as a less heroic and unarmed version of yourself. While this illusion lasts, your strikes gain an edge, and when you take the Disengage move action, you gain a +1 bonus to the distance you can shift.\nThe illusion ends when you harm another creature, when you physically interact with a creature, when you use this ability again, or when you end the illusion (no action required). If you end this illusion by harming another creature, you gain 1 surge
id-06003.name: I’m No Threat

notes.p: Taking on an illusory countenance gives you an advantage on
subterfuge.

id-06003.special: Spend 1 Insight: Choose a creature whose size is no more than 1 greater than yours and who is within 10 squares. This ability’s illusion makes you appear as that creature. This illusion covers your entire body, including clothing and armor, and alters your voice to sound like that of the creature. You gain an edge on tests made to convince the creature’s allies that you are the creature.

id-06004.effect: Choose an enemy within distance of the triggering strike, including the enemy who targeted you. The strike targets that enemy instead.
id-06004.name: Clever Trick

notes.p: You sow a moment of confusion in combat, to your enemy’s peril.

id-06004.trigger: An enemy targets you with a strike.

id-06005.effect: You take half the triggering damage, then can shift up to 2 squares after the triggering effect resolves. If you end this shift with concealment or cover, you can use the Hide maneuver even if you are observed.
id-06005.name: Defensive Roll

notes.p: When an enemy attacks, you roll with the impact to reduce the harm.

id-06005.special: Spend 1 Insight: The potency of any effects associated with the damage are reduced by 1 for you.

id-06007.effect: You take half the damage, then can teleport up to 4 squares after the triggering effect resolves.
id-06007.name: In All This Confusion

notes.p: You vanish in a plume of black smoke to avoid danger.

id-06007.special: Spend 1+ Insight: You teleport 1 additional square for each insight spent.

id-06008.effect: You take your turn after the triggering hero.
id-06008.name: Hesitation Is Weakness

notes.p: Keep up the attack. Never give them a moment’s grace.

id-06008.trigger: Another hero ends their turn. That hero can’t have used this ability to start their turn.

id-06009.effect: One ally within 5 squares of the target gains 1 surge.
id-06009.name: Gasping in Pain

notes.p: Your precise strikes let your allies take advantage of a target’s agony.

id-06010.effect: If any ally is adjacent to the target, you gain 1 surge before making the power roll.
id-06010.name: Teamwork Has Its Place

notes.p: You attack an enemy as an ally exposes their weakness.

id-06011.effect: As long as you have one or more allies within 5 squares of the target, you gain 1 surge. If you are flanking the target when you use this ability, choose one ally who is flanking with you. That ally also gains 1 surge.
id-06011.name: You Were Watching the Wrong One

notes.p: They can’t watch both of you at once.

id-06012.effect: If the target has no allies adjacent to them, you gain 1 surge before making the power roll.
id-06012.name: I Work Better Alone

notes.p: “It’s better, just you and me. Isn’t it?”
A bargain.

id-06014.effect: You can shift into any square the target leaves when you slide them.
id-06014.name: Disorienting Strike (3 Insight)

notes.p: Your attack leaves them reeling, allowing you to follow up.

id-06015.effect: You can shift up to your speed, dividing that movement before or after your strike as desired.
id-06015.name: Get In Get Out (3 Insight)

notes.p: Move unexpectedly, strike fast, and be gone!
You leave your foe bleeding out after a devastating attack.

id-06017.effect: You can shift into any square the target leaves when you slide them.
id-06017.name: Setup (5 Insight)

notes.p: Your friends will thank you.

id-06017.tier1: 6 + [A] damage; [R] < [WEAK], the target has damage weakness 5 (save ends)
id-06017.tier2: 9 + [A] damage; [R] < [AVERAGE], the target has damage weakness 5 (save ends)
id-06017.tier3: 13 + [A] damage; [R] < [STRONG], the target has damage weakness 5 (save ends)

id-06018.effect: You use a strike signature ability twice.
id-06018.name: Shadowstrike (5 Insight)

notes.p: They have no idea what the college taught you.
Your blade might be the last thing they see.

id-06020.effect: You shift up to your speed and make one power roll that targets up to three enemies who came adjacent to you during the move.
id-06020.name: One Hundred Throats (5 Insight)

notes.p: As you move across the battlefield, every foe within reach feels your
wrath.

id-07019.effect: Additionally, if you have 24 hours or more before a combat encounter or negotiation, and you have one or more clues or rumors regarding the encounter or negotiation, you can make a Reason test as a respite activity.
id-07019.name: Studied Commander (Encounter)

notes.p: Your encyclopedic knowledge of the history of battle lets you apply that knowledge to current challenges.

id-07019.special: You can make this test only once for any encounter or negotiation.
id-07019.tier1: The Director tells you the number of creatures in the encounter.
id-07019.tier2: The Director tells you the number and level of the creatures in the encounter
id-07019.tier3: The Director tells you the tier 2 outcome information, and when the encounter begins, all enemies are surprised.

id-07020.effect: Additionally, if you have 24 hours or more before a combat encounter or negotiation, and you have one or more clues or rumors regarding the encounter or negotiation, you can make a Reason test as a respite activity.
id-07020.name: Studied Commander (Negotiation)

notes.p: Your encyclopedic knowledge of the history of battle lets you apply that knowledge to current challenges.

id-07020.special: You can make this test only once for any encounter or negotiation.
id-07020.tier1: The Director gives you three motivations, one of which belongs to an NPC in the negotiation.
id-07020.tier2: The Director gives you one motivation for an NPC in the negotiation.
id-07020.tier3: The Director tells you the tier 2 outcome information, and you and each of your allies gains an edge on tests made to influence NPCs during the negotiation.

id-07021.effect: You can shift 1 square. If the target is you, or if you end this shift adjacent to the target, the target takes half the damage. If the damage has any potency effect associated with it, the potency is decreased by 1.
id-07021.name: Parry

notes.p: Your quick reflexes cost an enemy the precision they seek.

id-07021.special: Spend 1 Focus: This ability’s distance becomes Melee 1 + your Reason score, and you can shift up to a number of squares equal to your Reason score instead of 1 square.
id-07021.trigger: A creature deals damage to the target.

id-07022.effect: At any time during the target's movement, one ally can make a free strike against them.
id-07022.name: Overwatch

notes.p: Under your direction, an ally waits for just the right moment to strike.

id-07022.special: Spend 1 Focus: If the target is [R]<[AVERAGE], they are slowed (EoT)

id-07023.effect: The target gains 2 surges, which they can use on the triggering damage.
id-07023.name: Advanced Tactics

notes.p: Your leadership aids an ally.

id-07023.special: Spend 1 Focus: If the damage has any potency effect associated with it, the potency is increased by 1.
id-07023.trigger: The target deals damage to another creature.

id-07024.effect: The target is marked by you until the end of the encounter, until you are dying, or until you use this ability again. You can willingly end your mark on a creature (no action required), and if another tactician marks a creature, your mark on that creature ends. When a creature marked by you is reduced to 0 Stamina, you can use a free triggered action to mark a new target within distance.\n\nYou can initially mark only one creature using this ability, though other tactician abilities allow you to mark additional creatures at the same time. The mastermind tactical doctrine’s Anticipation feature allows you to target additional creatures with this ability starting at 5th level.
id-07024.name: Mark

notes.p: You draw your allies' attention to a specific foe─ with devastating effect.

id-07024.special:
While a creature marked by you is within your line of effect, you and allies within your line of effect gain an edge on power rolls made against that creature. Additionally, whenever you or any ally uses an ability to deal rolled damage to a creature marked by you, you can spend 1 focus to gain one of the following benefits as a free triggered action:
♦ The ability deals extra damage equal to twice your Reason score.
♦ The creature dealing the damage can spend a Recovery.
♦ The creature dealing the damage can shift up to a number of squares equal to your Reason score.
♦ If you damage a creature marked by you with a melee ability, the creature is taunted by you until the end of their next turn. You can’t gain more than one benefit from the same trigger.

id-07025.effect: The target can use a signature ability as a free triggered action.
id-07025.name: Strike Now!

notes.p: Your foe left an opening. You point this out to an ally!

id-07025.special: Spend 5 Focus: You target two allies instead of one.

id-07026.effect: Each target can move up to their speed.
id-07026.name: Squad! Forward! (3 Focus)

notes.p: On your command, you and your allies force back the enemy line.

id-07027.name: Inspiring Strike (3 Focus)

notes.p: Your attack gives an ally hope.

id-07027.tier1: 3 + [M] damage, you or one ally within 10 squares of you can spend a Recovery
id-07027.tier2: 5 + [M] damage, you or one ally within 10 squares of you can spend a Recovery
id-07027.tier3: 8 + [M] damage, you or one ally within 10 squares of you can spend a Recovery, and each of you gains an edge on the next ability roll you make during the encounter

notes.p: Your precise strike leaves your foe struggling to respond.
You shout a phrase that galvanizes your team.

id-07030.effect: Each target can make a free strike.
id-07030.name: Now! (5 Focus)

notes.p: Your allies wait for your command—then unleash death!

id-07031.effect: Before the start of your next turn, the first time any ally deals damage to any target marked by you, that ally can spend a Recovery.
id-07031.name: Mind Game (5 Focus)

notes.p: Your attack demoralizes your foe. Your allies begin to think you can win.

id-07032.effect: If the target is reduced to 0 Stamina before one or both chosen allies has made their strike, the ally or allies can pick a different target.
id-07032.name: Hammer and Anvil (5 Focus)

notes.p: "Let's not argue about who's the hammer and who's the anvil!"

id-07032.tier1: 5 + [M] damage; one ally within 10 squares of you can use a strike signature ability against the target as a free triggered action
id-07032.tier2: 9 + [M] damage; one ally within 10 squares of you can use a strike signature ability against the target as a free triggered action
id-07032.tier3: 12 + [M] damage; two allies within 10 squares of you can use a strike signature ability that gains an edge against the target as a free triggered action

id-07033.effect: Each target who hasn't acted yet this combat round can take their turn in any order immediately after your.
id-07033.name: This is What We Planned For! (5 Focus)

notes.p: All those coordination drills you made them do finally pay off.

id-08021.name: Mind Spike

notes.p: A telepathic bolt instantly zaps a creature’s brain.

id-08021.special: Strained: The target takes an extra 2 psychic damage. You also take 2 psychic damage that can’t be reduced in any way.

id-08022.effect: The target shifts up to a number of squares equal to your Reason score.
id-08022.name: Accelerate

notes.p: To your ally, it seems as though the world has slowed down.

id-08022.special: Spend 2 Clarity: The target can use a maneuver.

id-08023.effect: The target takes half the triggering damage, or the distance of the triggering forced movement is reduced by a number of squares equal to your Reason score. If the target took damage and was force moved, you choose the effect. If the forced movement is reduced to 0 squares, the target can push the source of the forced movement a number of squares equal to your Reason score.
id-08023.name: Repel

notes.p: They aren’t going anywhere, but you might!

id-08023.trigger: The target takes damage or is force moved.

id-08024.effect: The target takes psychic damage equal to half the triggering damage.
id-08024.name: Feedback Loop

notes.p: Creating a brief psychic link between an enemy and their target gives that foe a taste of their own medicine.

id-08024.trigger: The target deals damage to an ally.

id-08025.effect: You slide the target up to a number of squares equal to your Reason score.
id-08025.name: Minor Telekinesis

notes.p: Wisps of psychic energy ripple visibly from your brain as you force the target to move using only your mind.

id-08025.special: Spend 2+ Clarity: The size of the creature or object you can target increases by 1 for every 2 clarity spent.\n\nSpend 3 Clarity: You can vertical slide the target.
id-08025.target: Self or one size 1 creature or object

id-08026.effect: You can use this ability after seeing the result of the triggering roll. The target must reroll the power roll and use the new roll.
id-08026.name: Again

notes.p: You step back a split second to see if things play out a little differently.

id-08026.trigger: The target makes an ability roll.

id-08027.effect: The next ability roll an ally makes against the target before the start of your next turn gains an edge.
id-08027.name: Remote Assistance

notes.p: An ally gains the benefit of your intellect.

id-08027.special: Spend 1 Clarity: You target one additional creature or object.

id-08028.effect: The target takes an extra 1 corruption damage for each additional time they are targeted by this ability during the encounter.
id-08028.name: Entropic Bolt

notes.p: You advance an enemy’s age for a moment.

id-08028.special: Strained: You gain 1 clarity when you obtain a tier 2 or tier 3 out- come on the power roll.

id-08029.name: Hoarfrost

notes.p: You blast a foe with a pulse of cold energy.

id-08029.special: Strained: You are slowed until the end of your next turn. Additional- ly, a target slowed by this ability is restrained instead.

id-08030.name: Spirit Sword

notes.p: You form a blade of mind energy and stab your target, invigorating yourself.

id-08030.special: Strained: The target takes an extra 3 damage. You also take 3 damage that can’t be reduced in any way.

id-08031.effect: A column of fire remains in the area until the start of your next turn. Each enemy who enters the area for the first time in a combat round or starts their turn there takes 2 fire damage.
id-08031.name: Incinerate

notes.p: The air erupts into a column of smokeless flame.

id-08031.special: Strained: The size of the cube increases by 2, but the fire disappears at the end of your turn.

id-08032.effect: When targeting an object with a solid reflective surface or a creature carrying or wearing such an object (such as a mirror, an unpainted metal shield, or shiny metal plate armor), you can target one additional creature or object within 3 squares of the first target.
id-08032.name: Optic Blast

notes.p: Your eyes emit rays of powerful enervating force.

id-08032.special: Strained: You gain 1 surge that you can use immediately, and you take damage equal to your Reason score that can’t be reduced in any way.

id-08033.effect: A worthless size 1M object drops onto the target to deal the damage, then rolls into an adjacent unoccupied space of your choice. The object is made of wood, stone, or metal (your choice).
id-08033.name: Materialize

notes.p: You picture an object in your mind and give it form—directly above your opponent’s head.

id-08033.special: Strained: The object explodes after the damage is dealt, and each creature adjacent to the target takes damage equal to your Reason score. You also take damage equal to your Reason score that can’t be reduced in any way.

id-08034.name: Kinetic Pulse

notes.p: The force of your mind hurls enemies backward.

id-08034.special: Strained: The size of the burst increases by 2, and you are bleeding\nuntil the start of your next turn.

id-08035.name: Kinetic Grip

notes.p: You lift and hurl your foe away from you.

id-08035.special: Strained: You must vertical push the target instead of sliding them.

notes.p: You project psionic energy out to a creature and take on a new visage in their mind.

id-08040.effect: You can vertical pull the target up to 2 squares. If the target is made restrained by this ability, this forced movement ignores their stability.
id-08040.name: Choke (3 Clarity)

notes.p: You crush a foe in a telekinetic grip.

id-08041.effect: Ability rolls made against the target take a bane until the start of your next turn. Whenever the target takes damage while under this effect, they can use a triggered action to make a free strike against the source of the damage.
id-08041.name: Precognition (3 Clarity)

notes.p: You give a target a glimpse into the future so that they’re ready for what comes next.

id-08042.effect: Choose the damage type and the weakness for this ability from one of the following: acid, corruption, or fire. The target takes damage before this ability imposes any weakness.
id-08042.name: Smolder (3 Clarity)

notes.p: Smoke flows from your enemy like tears as their skin begins to black- en and flake.

id-08042.tier1: 3 + [R] damage; [R] < [WEAK], the target has weakness 5 (save ends)
id-08042.tier2: 6 + [R] damage; [R] < [AVERAGE], the target has weakness 5 (save ends)
id-08042.tier3: 9 + [R] damage; [R] < [STRONG], the target has weakness equal to 5 + your Reason score (save ends)

id-08043.effect: The target uses an ability with a base Heroic Resource cost of 7 or lower that they’ve previously used this round, without needing to spend the base cost. Augmentations to the ability can be paid for as usual.
id-08043.name: Flashback (5 Clarity)

notes.p: The target is thrown several seconds back through time and gets to do it all again.

id-08043.special: Strained: You take 1d6 damage and are slowed (save ends).

id-08044.effect: The target ignores difficult terrain and takes no damage from forced movement until the start of your next turn. Whenever the target enters a square while under this effect, they can push one adjacent creature up to 2 squares. When pushing an ally, the target can ignore that ally’s stability.
id-08044.name: Inertia Soak (5 Clarity)

notes.p: Your psionic energy surrounds the target and pushes everything else away from them.

id-08044.special: Strained: You are weakened (save ends). While you are weakened this way, whenever you are force moved, the forced movement distance gains a +5 bonus.

id-08045.effect: The target’s stability increases by an amount equal to your Reason score, and they gain 10 temporary Stamina and 2 surges. This stability increase lasts until the target no longer has temporary Stamina from this ability.
id-08045.name: Iron (5 Clarity)

notes.p: The target’s skin turns to hard, dark metal, impenetrable and dense.

id-08045.special: Strained: You can’t use maneuvers (save ends).

id-08046.effect: Until the start of your next turn, the target gains a +3 bonus to speed, and they have a double edge on the next power roll they make. If the target obtains a tier 3 outcome on that roll, you gain 1 clarity.
id-08046.name: Perfect Clarity (5 Clarity)

notes.p: You clear the mind of nothing but the goal.

id-08046.special: Strained: You take 1d6 damage, and you can’t use triggered actions (save ends).

id-09034.effect: At the end of each of your turns while this performance is active, you can choose up to a number of targets equal to your Presence score. Each chosen target can spend a Recovery.
id-09034.name: Revitalizing Limerick

notes.p: There was once a man from Capital...

id-09034.target: Self and each ally in the area

id-09035.effect: While this performance is active, each target who starts their turn in the area gains a +2 bonus to speed until the end of their turn.
id-09035.name: Choreography

notes.p: Taps, kicks, steps. It's all "choreography."

id-09035.target: Self and each ally in the area

id-09036.effect: An edge on the triggering roll becomes a bane, or a double edge becomes an edge. A bane becomes an edge, or a double bane becomes a bane.
id-09036.name: Turnabout Is Fair Play

notes.p: All's fair in love and whatever.

id-09036.special: Spend 3 Drama: An edge on the triggering roll becomes a double bane, or a double edge is negated. A bane becomes a double edge, or a double bane is negated.
id-09036.trigger: The target makes an ability roll that has an edge, a double edge, a bane, or a double bane.

id-09037.effect: You gain a +2 bonus to speed until the end of your turn. Additionally, the next power roll you make this turn can't have an outcome lower than tier 2.
id-09037.name: Star Power (1 Drama)

notes.p: Your years of practicing fencing and dancing pay off on the battlefield.

id-09037.special: Spend 1 Drama: You gain a +4 bonus to speed instead.

notes.p: Your instrument rings true and your music blows everyone away.

id-09039.effect:
Choose one of the following effects:
♦ You orate a rousing tale of victory. One ally within distance gains an edge on the next power roll they make before the start of your next turn.
♦ You weave a tale of high-stakes heroics. One ally within distance gains 1 surge.
♦ You insult a foe where they’re most vulnerable. One enemy within distance takes a bane on the next power roll they make before the end of their next turn.
id-09039.name: Dramatic Monologue

notes.p: It doesn't need to make sense. Just say it with emotion.

id-09039.special: Spend 1 Drama: You can choose two targets for the chosen effect.

id-09040.effect: At the end of each of your turns while this performance is active, you can choose up to a number of targets equal to your Presence score and teleport those targets to unoccupied spaces in the area. A target can’t be teleported in a way that would harm them (such as over a cliff), leave them dying, or result in them suffering a condition or other negative effect.
id-09040.name: Blocking

notes.p: No, no, no, you lose the audience that way. Try it like this...

id-09041.effect: While this performance is active, each target who starts their turn in the area can automatically obtain a tier 3 outcome on one test made to jump, tumble, or climb as part of their movement before the end of their turn.
id-09041.name: Acrobatics

notes.p: Folks love a good tumble.

id-09041.target: Self and each ally in the area

id-09042.effect: While this performance is active, each target who starts their turn in the area gains 1 surge.
id-09042.name: “Ballad of the Beast” (Virtuoso Performance)

notes.p: Teeth are bare! ♫ Eyes black! ♫ ♪ No escaping the beast!♫

id-09042.target: Self and each ally in the area

id-09043.effect: At the end of each combat round while this performance is active, you can make a power roll against the target that ignores cover. You can’t target the same creature twice with this effect.
id-09043.name: "Thunder Mother" (Virtuoso Performance)

notes.p: All for thunder motherrr! ♪ Run and hide for coverrr!♫

id-09043.tier1: Lightning damage equal to your level
id-09043.tier2: Lightning damage equal to 5 + your level
id-09043.tier3: Lightning damage equal to 10 + your level

id-09044.effect: The target makes a free strike against the creature who made the triggering strike.
id-09044.name: Riposte

notes.p: "I’d have brought treats had I known I’d be fighting a dog.

id-09044.trigger: The target takes damage from a melee strike.

id-09045.effect: The target can choose one additional target for the triggering ability. Any damage dealt to the additional target is sonic damage.
id-09045.name: Harmonize (3 Drama)

notes.p: Give the chorus a little punch.

id-09045.special: Spend 1+ Drama: You can trigger this ability when a target uses an ability that has a Heroic Resource cost of 3 + each additional drama spent.
id-09045.trigger: The target uses an ability that targets only one enemy and costs 3 or fewer of their Heroic Resource.

id-09046.effect: One ally within 10 squares of you can end one effect on them that is ended by a saving throw or that ends at the end of their turn.
id-09046.name: Witty Banter

notes.p: A lyrical (and physical) jab insults an enemy and inspires an ally.

id-09046.special: Spend 1 Drama: The chosen ally can spend a Recovery.

id-09047.effect: The target is taunted by you or a willing ally adjacent to you until the end of the target’s next turn.
id-09047.name: Instigator

notes.p: I didn't do it! What?
There you are, radiating your usual charisma.

id-09049.effect: You can shift up to 3 squares.
id-09049.name: Artful Flourish

notes.p: And they said practicing fencing was a waste!

id-09049.special: Spend 2+ Drama: You can target one additional creature or object for every 2 drama spent.

id-09050.effect: You can become bleeding (save ends) to deal an extra 5 corruption damage to the target.
id-09050.name: Method Acting (5 Drama)

notes.p: They're so hurt by your performance, you start to believe it yourself.

id-09051.effect: You shift up to your speed. You make one power roll that targets each enemy you move adjacent to during this shift.
id-09051.name: Upstage (3 Drama)

notes.p: As you bob and weave through the crowd, you can't help but leave the audience wanting more.

id-09052.effect: The area is difficult terrain for enemies.
id-09052.name: Quick Rewrite (3 Drama)

notes.p: You write something unexpected into the scene that hinders your enemy.

id-09053.name: Hypnotic Overtones (3 Drama)

notes.p: You produce an entrancing note that twists the senses in a spectacular fashion.

id-09053.special: Spend 2+ Drama: The size of the burst increases by 1 for every 2 drama spent.

id-09054.effect: The first time the target uses an ability before the start of your next turn, any effects from the ability’s tier outcomes other than damage are negated for all targets. Ability effects that always happen regardless of the power roll work as usual.
id-09054.name: Harsh Critic (3 Drama)

notes.p: Just one bad review will ruin their day.

id-09055.effect: Each target can teleport up to 5 squares. Any teleported target who was slowed is no longer slowed.
id-09055.name: Flip the Script (5 Drama)

notes.p: You try a different take on events, justifying the new locations everyone ended up in.

id-09055.target: Self and each ally in the area

id-09056.effect: You turn invisible and create a magical illusion of your corpse falling in your space. While you are invisible, you gain a +3 bonus to speed and you ignore difficult terrain. The illusion and your invisibility last until the end of your next turn, or until the illusion is interacted with, you take damage, or you use a main action or a maneuver.
id-09056.name: Fake Your Death (5 Drama)

notes.p: O happy dagger, this is thy sheath!

id-09057.name: Dramatic Reversal (5 Drama)

notes.p: Give the audience a surprise.

id-09057.target: Self and each ally in the area
id-09057.tier1: The target can shift 1 square and make a free strike.
id-09057.tier2: The target can shift up to 2 squares and make a free strike that gains an edge.
id-09057.tier3: The target can shift up to 3 squares and make a free strike that gains an edge, then can spend a Recovery.

id-00001.effect: You can shapeshift into the animal defined by your stormwight kit, into a hybrid form, or back into your true form. While in animal form or hybrid form, you can speak as you usually do, and you can also speak to animals who share your form. If you are in a negotiation with an animal while in animal form, you treat your Renown as 2 higher than usual.
id-00001.name: Aspect of the Wild

p.i: You assume the form of the animal who channels your ferocity.

id-00001.special: Spend 1 Ferocity: As a free maneuver, you can shapeshift a second time, either into another animal form, into your hybrid form, or back into your true form.

basicnotes.p: Starting Characteristics: You start with a Might of 2 and a Presence of 2, and you can choose one of the following arrays for your other characteristic scores:
Skills: Choose any two skills from the interpersonal or lore skill groups (Quick Build: Intimidate, Religion.)

text.p: You specialize in hunting your order's hidden enemies, knowing that an open mind is an unguarded fortress. You have the Read Person skill.
Corruption has deep tendrils that can be missed, leading you to specialize in uncovering clandestine threats to your order. You have the Magic skill.
Without a strong example and a firm hand, the weak will be corrupted. You specialize in setting an example for your order. You have the Lead skill.
The gods favor your thievery with magic. Whenever you make a test that uses a skill you have from the intrigue skill group, you can use Presence on the test instead of another characteristic.

Each time you finish a respite, you can choose yourself or one ally who is also finishing a respite to gain the benefit of a divine ritual. You place a ray of morning light into the chosen character’s soul, granting them a +1 bonus to saving throws that lasts until you finish another respite.

Each time you finish a respite, you can decide the weather conditions within 100 squares. Until you finish another respite, the weather conditions you establish follow you through any mundane outdoor locations. Choose one of the following types of weather, each of which grants a benefit to you and your allies:
Clear : You and your allies gain an edge on tests that use the Search or Navigate skills.
Foggy : You and your allies gain an edge on tests that use the Hide skill.
Overcast : You and your allies gain an edge on tests that use the Endurance skill.
Precipitation : When the ground is muddy or snowy, you and your allies gain an edge on tests that use the Track skill.
If you are in the same area as a creature using this or a similar feature who has chosen a different weather effect, the features negate each other where their areas overlap.

You can spend 10 uninterrupted minutes to create a protective circle on the ground large enough to hold one size 1 creature. The circle lasts for 24 hours, until you create another, or until you dismiss it (no action required). Only creatures you designate at the time of drawing the circle can enter and exit the area. While in the protective circle, a creature can’t be targeted by strikes.
You exude a magic presence that can soothe those willing to socially engage with you. You gain an edge on any test made to assist another creature with a test.

Additionally, when you are present at the start of a negotiation, one NPC of your choice has their patience increased by 1 (to a maximum of 5), and the first test made to influence them gains an edge.

Each time you finish a respite, you can choose yourself or one ally who is also finishing a respite to gain the benefit of a divine ritual. The chosen character gains a bonus to their recovery value equal to your level that lasts until you finish another respite.

You can interpret diagrams and charts even if you don’t understand the language associated with them. You are considered fluent in all languages for the purpose of understanding the project source for any crafting or research project (see Chapter 12: Downtime Projects).

Your deity rewards you with hazy visions of things to come. Each time you earn 1 or more Victories, you earn an equal number of fate points. Whenever you or a creature within 10 squares makes a test, you can spend 1 fate point to tap into a vision of the outcome, granting that creature an edge on the test. You lose any remaining fate points when you finish a respite.

As a respite activity, you can bless a weapon. Any creature who wields the weapon gains a +1 bonus to rolled damage with abilities that use the weapon. This benefit lasts until you finish another respite.

featureext.p: Choose a god or saint who your character reveres from Chapter 14: Gods and Religion, or ask your Director about the deities in your campaign world. With the Director's permission, you can also create your own deity and choose four domains to be part of their portfolio.
After choosing your deity, pick one domain from their portfolio. Your choice of domain determines many of the features you'll gain from this class. (Quick Build: Cavall as deity and War as domain.)

id-00001.name: Deity and Domains
id-00001.text: Choose a god or saint who your character reveres from Chapter 14: Gods and Religion, or ask your Director about the deities in your campaign world. With the Director's permission, you can also create your own deity and choose four domains to be part of their portfolio.\n\nAfter choosing your deity, pick one domain from their portfolio. Your choice of domain determines many of the features you'll gain from this class. (Quick Build: Cavall as deity and War as domain.)

featureext.p: The power you serve grants you a Heroic Resource called wrath, fueling your abilities as you censor those your church deems to be heretics.

At the start of a combat encounter or some other stressful situation tracked in combat rounds (as determined by the Director), you gain wrath equal to your Victories. At the start of each of your turns during combat, you gain 2 wrath.

Additionally, the first time each combat round that a creature judged by you (see Judgment below) deals damage to you, you gain 1 wrath. The first time each combat round that you deal damage to a creature judged by you, you gain 1 wrath.
You lose any remaining wrath at the end of the encounter.

Though you can’t gain wrath outside of combat, you can use your heroic abilities and effects that cost wrath without spending it. Whenever you use an ability or effect outside of combat that costs wrath, you can’t use that same ability or effect outside of combat again until you earn 1 or more Victories or finish a respite.

When you use an ability outside of combat that lets you spend unlimited wrath on its effect, you can use it as if you had spent an amount of wrath equal to your Victories. (Such abilities aren’t part of the core rules for the censor, but they might appear in future products.)

id-00002.name: Wrath
id-00002.text:
The power you serve grants you a Heroic Resource called wrath, fueling your abilities as you censor those your church deems to be heretics.

===Wrath in Combat===
At the start of a combat encounter or some other stressful situation tracked in combat rounds (as determined by the Director), you gain wrath equal to your Victories. At the start of each of your turns during combat, you gain 2 wrath.

Additionally, the first time each combat round that a creature judged by you (see Judgment below) deals damage to you, you gain 1 wrath. The first time each combat round that you deal damage to a creature judged by you, you gain 1 wrath.

You lose any remaining wrath at the end of the encounter.

===Wrath outside of Combat===
Though you can’t gain wrath outside of combat, you can use your heroic abilities and effects that cost wrath without spending it. Whenever you use an ability or effect outside of combat that costs wrath, you can’t use that same ability or effect outside of combat again until you earn 1 or more Victories or finish a respite.

When you use an ability outside of combat that lets you spend unlimited wrath on its effect, you can use it as if you had spent an amount of wrath equal to your Victories. (Such abilities aren’t part of the core rules for the censor, but they might appear in future products.)

featureext.p: You pick out the enemies most worthy of your wrath and place a divine judgment upon them, censoring them with the power of your god. You have the following ability.
The first time on a turn that you use your Judgment ability to judge a creature, you gain the following benefit based on your order:

♦ Exorcist: You can teleport up to a number of squares equal to twice your Presence score. This movement must take you closer to the judged creature. You do not need line of effect to your destination.
♦ Oracle: You can deal holy damage equal to twice your Presence score to the judged creature.
♦ Paragon: You can vertical pull the judged creature up to a number of squares equal to twice your Presence score.

id-00003.name: Judgment
id-00003.text: You pick out the enemies most worthy of your wrath and place a divine judgment upon them, censoring them with the power of your god. You have the following ability.\n*Ability: Judgement

featureext.p: You can use and gain the benefits of a kit. See Chapter 6: Kits for more information. (Quick Build: Warrior Priest.)

id-00004.name: Kit
id-00004.text: You can use and gain the benefits of a kit. See Chapter 6: Kits for more information. (Quick Build: Warrior Priest.)

featureext.p: You channel your will to mend your wounds or the wounds of your allies. You have the following ability.

id-00005.name: My Life For Yours
id-00005.text: You channel your will to mend your wounds or the wounds of your allies. You have the following ability.\n*Ability: My Life for Yours\n

featureext.p: Choose one signature ability from the following options. Signature abilities can be used at will. (Quick Build: Your Allies Cannot Save You!)

linklist.link: Ability: Your Allies Cannot Save You!

featureext.p: You call upon a number of heroic abilities, all of them bound to your wrath.
Choose one heroic ability from the following options, each of which costs 3 wrath to use. (Quick Build: The Gods Punish and Defend.)

linklist.link: Ability: Behold a Shield of Faith! (3 Wrath)
Ability: The Gods Punish and Defend (3 Wrath)

featureext.p: Choose one heroic ability from the following options, each of which costs 5 wrath to use. (Quick Build: Purifying Fire.)

linklist.link: Ability: Behold the Face of Justice! (5 Wrath)

notes.p: Demons and deathless fear you. Criminals run from the sight of your shadow. Agents of chaos, blasphemers, and heretics tremble at the sound of your voice. You carry the power of the gods, armed with wrath and sent out into the world first to seek, then censor those whose actions-or even existence-are anathema to your church. As a censor, you're at your best against the strongest foes. Your judgment terrifies heretics, stops enemies in their tracks, and even hurls them across the battlefield.
notes.frame: Sir VaantikalisaxWe FIGHT! Until HELL! Is EMPTY!

notes.p: As a 1st-level censor, you gain the following features.

Censors are the will of their god made physically manifest, and you act as your god's agent in the world. As you shoulder that responsibility, you choose a censor order from the following options, each of which grants you a skill. (Quick Build: Paragon.)

list.li: Exorcist: You specialize in hunting your order's hidden enemies, knowing that an open mind is an unguarded fortress. You have the Read Person skill.
Oracle: Corruption has deep tendrils that can be missed, leading you to specialize in uncovering clandestine threats to your order. You have the Magic skill.
Paragon: Without a strong example and a firm hand, the weak will be corrupted. You specialize in setting an example for your order. You have the Lead skill.

notes.p: Your censor order is your subclass, and your choice of order determines many of the features you'll gain as you gain new levels.

At the start of a combat encounter or some other stressful situation tracked in combat rounds (as determined by the Director), you gain wrath equal to your Victories. At the start of each of your turns during combat, you gain 2 wrath.

Additionally, the first time each combat round that a creature judged by you (see Judgment below) deals damage to you, you gain 1 wrath. The first time each combat round that you deal damage to a creature judged by you, you gain 1 wrath.
You lose any remaining wrath at the end of the encounter.

Though you can’t gain wrath outside of combat, you can use your heroic abilities and effects that cost wrath without spending it. Whenever you use an ability or effect outside of combat that costs wrath, you can’t use that same ability or effect outside of combat again until you earn 1 or more Victories or finish a respite.

When you use an ability outside of combat that lets you spend unlimited wrath on its effect, you can use it as if you had spent an amount of wrath equal to your Victories. (Such abilities aren’t part of the core rules for the censor, but they might appear in future products.)

♦ Exorcist: You can teleport up to a number of squares equal to twice your Presence score. This movement must take you closer to the judged creature. You do not need line of effect to your destination.
♦ Oracle: You can deal holy damage equal to twice your Presence score to the judged creature.

basicnotes.p: Starting Characteristics: You start with an Intuition of 2, and can choose
one of the following arrays for your other characteristics scores:
Skills: Choose any two skills from the interpersonal or lore skill groups (Quick Build: Intimidate, Religion.)

text.p: Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that a creature within 10 squares uses an area ability.
Prayer Effect: You summon the forces of creation and create a wall of stone within 10 squares whose size is 5 + your Intuition score. The wall lasts until the end of the encounter.

Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that a creature within 10 squares who isn’t a minion is reduced to 0 Stamina, or the first time in an encounter that a solo creature within 10 squares becomes winded.
Prayer Effect: You inflict a deadly curse on up to two enemies within 10 squares of you. Each target takes corruption damage equal to twice your Intuition score.
Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that an ally within 10 squares obtains a tier 3 outcome on a power roll, or an enemy within 10 squares obtains a tier 1 outcome on a power roll.

Prayer Effect: You call on the forces of fate to create a reliable future. Choose a creature within 10 squares. That creature automatically obtains a tier 1 or tier 3 outcome (your choice) on their next power roll made before the end of the encounter.
Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that the Director spends Malice (see Draw Steel: Monsters).
Prayer Effect: Choose up to five allies within 10 squares of you, or choose yourself instead of one ally. Each target gains 1 surge.
Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that a creature within 10 squares regains Stamina.

Prayer Effect: Choose yourself or one ally within 10 squares. That character can spend a Recovery, can end one effect on them that is ended by a saving throw or that ends at the end of their turn, or can stand up if they are prone. Alternatively, you or one ally within 10 squares gains temporary Stamina equal to two times your Intuition score.
Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that you or any ally within 10 squares uses the Aid Attack maneuver or an ability that targets an ally.
Prayer Effect: Each ally within 10 squares of you gains temporary Stamina equal to two times your Intuition score.
Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that you or a creature within 10 squares takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or sonic damage.

Prayer Effect: Vines whip up from the floor or ground within 10 squares, wrapping around a number of creatures equal to your Intuition score. You can slide each creature up to a number of squares equal to your Intuition score. The vines then fade away.

Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that you or any ally within 10 squares gains temporary Stamina, or uses a triggered action to reduce incoming damage or to impose a bane or double bane on an enemy’s power roll.
Prayer Effect: One ally within 10 squares gains temporary Stamina equal to four times your Intuition score.
Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that an enemy within 10 squares is force moved.
Prayer Effect: Each enemy in a 3 cube within 10 squares takes lightning damage equal to twice your Intuition score.
The gods imbue a divine swiftness within you. Whenever an adjacent creature deals damage to you, you can shift up to a number of squares equal to your Intuition score after the damage is dealt.
Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that an enemy within 10 squares takes fire or holy damage.
Prayer Effect: One enemy within 10 squares takes fire damage equal to three times your Intuition score.
Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that you or a creature within 10 squares takes the Aid Attack or Hide maneuver.
Prayer Effect: You slide one creature within 10 squares of you up to a number of squares equal to 5 + your conduit level.
Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that you or a creature within 10 squares takes damage greater than 10 + your level in a single turn.
Prayer Effect: Choose up to three allies within 10 squares of you, or choose yourself instead of one ally. Each target gains 2 surges.

In response to a foe’s aggression, your god protects you. Whenever another creature damages you, that creature can’t target you with a strike until you harm them or one of their allies, or until the end of their next turn.
Your god grants you a holy countenance that protects you at all times. You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws.
Invisible spirits surround you if you are harmed. Whenever an adjacent creature deals damage to you, they take corruption damage equal to your Intuition score.

Your deity rewards you with hazy visions of things to come. Each time you earn 1 or more Victories, you earn an equal number of fate points. Whenever you or a creature within 10 squares makes a test, you can spend 1 fate point to tap into a vision of the outcome, granting that creature an edge on the test. You lose any remaining fate points when you finish a respite.

You can interpret diagrams and charts even if you don’t understand the language associated with them. You are considered fluent in all languages for the purpose of understanding the project source for any crafting or research project (see Chapter 12: Downtime Projects).

Each time you finish a respite, you can choose yourself or one ally who is also finishing a respite to gain the benefit of a divine ritual. The chosen character gains a bonus to their recovery value equal to your level that lasts until you finish another respite.
You exude a magic presence that can soothe those willing to socially engage with you. You gain an edge on any test made to assist another creature with a test.

Additionally, when you are present at the start of a negotiation, one NPC of your choice has their patience increased by 1 (to a maximum of 5), and the first test made to influence them gains an edge.

You can spend 10 uninterrupted minutes to create a protective circle on the ground large enough to hold one size 1 creature. The circle lasts for 24 hours, until you create another, or until you dismiss it (no action required). Only creatures you designate at the time of drawing the circle can enter and exit the area. While in the protective circle, a creature can’t be targeted by strikes.

Each time you finish a respite, you can decide the weather conditions within 100 squares. Until you finish another respite, the weather conditions you establish follow you through any mundane outdoor locations. Choose one of the following types of weather, each of which grants a benefit to you and your allies:
Clear : You and your allies gain an edge on tests that use the Search or Navigate skills.
Foggy : You and your allies gain an edge on tests that use the Hide skill.
Overcast : You and your allies gain an edge on tests that use the Endurance skill.
Precipitation : When the ground is muddy or snowy, you and your allies gain an edge on tests that use the Track skill.
If you are in the same area as a creature using this or a similar feature who has chosen a different weather effect, the features negate each other where their areas overlap.

Each time you finish a respite, you can choose yourself or one ally who is also finishing a respite to gain the benefit of a divine ritual. You place a ray of morning light into the chosen character’s soul, granting them a +1 bonus to saving throws that lasts until you finish another respite.
The gods favor your thievery with magic. Whenever you make a test that uses a skill you have from the intrigue skill group, you can use Presence on the test instead of another characteristic.

As a respite activity, you can bless a weapon. Any creature who wields the weapon gains a +1 bonus to rolled damage with abilities that use the weapon. This benefit lasts until you finish another respite.

Your god fills your body with the light of creation, making you harder to hurt and move. You gain a +6 bonus to Stamina, and this bonus increases by 6 at 4th, 7th, and 10th levels. Additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to stability.
You can change your prayer along with your ward (see Conduit Ward below) by praying to your god as a respite activity. (Quick Build: Prayer of Distance.)
Your god blesses your flesh and infuses it with divine quickness. You gain a +1 bonus to speed and to the distance you can shift when you take the Disengage move action.
You can change your prayer along with your ward (see Conduit Ward below) by praying to your god as a respite activity. (Quick Build: Prayer of Distance.)

Your god gives your mind the training of a soldier. You can wear light armor and wield light weapons effectively, even though you don’t have a kit. While you wear light armor, you gain a +3 bonus to Stamina, and that bonus increases by 3 at 4th, 7th, and 10th levels. While you wield a light weapon, you gain a +1 damage bonus with weapon abilities, including free strikes. You can use light armor treasures and light weapon treasures. If you have a kit, you can’t take this blessing.
You can change your prayer along with your ward (see Conduit Ward below) by praying to your god as a respite activity. (Quick Build: Prayer of Distance.)
Your god blesses you with the ability to stretch your divine magic farther. You have a +2 bonus to the distance of your ranged magic abilities.
You can change your prayer along with your ward (see Conduit Ward below) by praying to your god as a respite activity. (Quick Build: Prayer of Distance.)
Your god infuses wrath within your being. You gain a +1 bonus to rolled damage with magic abilities.
You can change your prayer along with your ward (see Conduit Ward below) by praying to your god as a respite activity. (Quick Build: Prayer of Distance.)

featureext.p: You have the following ability, which you can use once on your turn.

Choose one of your domains. You gain a domain feature for that domain, as shown on the 1st-Level Conduit Domain Features table. Additionally, you gain a skill from the chosen domain, selected from the skill group indicated on the table. (Quick Build: Revitalizing Ritual and the Heal skill from the Life domain .)

Your choice of domains provides you with two additional ways to earn piety during combat, as triggered by specific events. You might even have a single event trigger both your piety effects. For example, the Sun domain grants piety when a nearby creature takes fire or holy damage, while the War domain grants piety when a nearby creature takes damage of 10 + your level or higher. If you have both those domains and a nearby creature takes an appropriate amount of fire damage, you gain piety from both your domains.
Additionally, whenever you activate a domain effect by praying for piety, you can choose one of your domains and have that domain’s prayer effect take effect immediately.

Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that a creature within 10 squares uses an area ability. Prayer Effect: You summon the forces of creation and create a wall of stone within 10 squares whose size is 5 + your Intuition score. The wall lasts until the end of the encounter.

Prayer Effect: You inflict a deadly curse on up to two enemies within 10 squares of you. Each target takes corruption damage equal to twice your Intuition score.

Prayer Effect: You call on the forces of fate to create a reliable future. Choose a creature within 10 squares. That creature automatically obtains a tier 1 or tier 3 outcome (your choice) on their next power roll made before the end of the encounter.

Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that a creature within 10 squares regains Stamina. Prayer Effect: Choose yourself or one ally within 10 squares. That character can spend a Recovery, can end one effect on them that is ended by a saving throw or that ends at the end of their turn, or can stand up if they are prone. Alternatively, you or one ally within 10 squares gains temporary Stamina equal to two times your Intuition score.

Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that you or any ally within 10 squares uses the Aid Attack maneuver or an ability that targets an ally. Prayer Effect: Each ally within 10 squares of you gains temporary Stamina equal to two times your Intuition score.

Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that you or a creature within 10 squares takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or sonic damage. Prayer Effect: Vines whip up from the floor or ground within 10 squares, wrapping around a number of creatures equal to your Intuition score. You can slide each creature up to a number of squares equal to your Intuition score. The vines then fade away.

Prayer Effect: One ally within 10 squares gains temporary Stamina equal to four times your Intuition score.

Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that an enemy within 10 squares is force moved. Prayer Effect: Each enemy in a 3 cube within 10 squares takes lightning damage equal to twice your Intuition score.

Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that an enemy within 10 squares takes fire or holy damage. Prayer Effect: One enemy within 10 squares takes fire damage equal to three times your Intuition score.

Piety: You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that you or a creature within 10 squares takes the Aid Attack or Hide maneuver. Prayer Effect: You slide one creature within 10 squares of you up to a number of squares equal to 5 + your conduit level.

Piety:You gain 2 piety the first time in an encounter that you or a creature within 10 squares takes damage greater than 10 + your level in a single turn. Prayer Effect: Choose up to three allies within 10 squares of you, or choose yourself instead of one ally. Each target gains 2 surges.
Your deity grants you a Heroic Resource called piety, letting you heal and empower your allies, and unleash holy power upon your foes.

At the start of a combat encounter or some other stressful situation tracked in combat rounds (as determined by the Director), you gain piety equal to your Victories. At the start of each of your turns during combat, you gain 1d3 piety.

Additionally, you can gain more piety by praying to the gods—but beware! Doing so can easily draw their ire, as the gods hate to be annoyed. Whenever you roll to gain piety at the start of your turn, you can pray (no action required). If you do, your roll gains the following additional effects:
♦ If the roll is a 1, you gain 1 additional piety but anger the gods! You take psychic damage equal to 1d6 + your level, which can’t be reduced in any way.
♦ If the roll is a 2, you gain 1 additional piety.
♦ If the roll is a 3, you gain 2 additional piety and can activate a domain effect of your choice (see below).
You lose any remaining piety at the end of the encounter.

Though you can’t gain piety outside of combat, you can use your heroic abilities and effects that cost piety without spending it. Whenever you use an ability or effect outside of combat that costs piety, you can’t use that same ability or effect outside of combat again until you earn 1 or more Victories or finish a respite.
When you use an ability outside of combat that lets you spend unlimited piety on its effect, such as Healing Grace, you can use it as if you had spent an amount of piety equal to your Victories.

Choose a god or saint who your character reveres from Chapter 14: Gods and Religion, or ask your Director about the deities in your campaign world. With the Director's permission, you can also create your own deity and choose four domains to be part of their portfolio.
After choosing your deity, pick one domain from their portfolio. Your choice of domain determines many of the features you'll gain from this class. (Quick Build: Cavall as deity and War as domain.)
You have the following ability, which can be used as a ranged free strike.
Choose one of the following triggered actions. (Quick Build: Word of Guidance. )
